instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 2016 MBP with TB 15"
threads.message: Anyone know of any powering up problems, or shut down problems inherent in these devices? This customer brought it in for me, I inspected it, no liquid damage anywhere... very clean. I plugged in a cord and it fired up... I loaded it up with stress, and nothing bad happened... so I sent it back to him... he brought it back and said it had the same problems... won't turn on etc... apple said they'd fix it for $800 but he didn't say what they were going to do. Any ideas? I dont have donor boards or anything to compare with for this beast.

threads.title: 2016 MBP with TB 15"
threads.message: If itâ€™s passing stress tests and all, it could be literally anything. Best thing to do is remove board and inspect for corrosion anywhere and everywhere on the board
